intro: Microstrobos fitzgeraldii, commonly known as the Fitzgerald's microstrobos, is a rare and unique plant species native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Podostomataceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and specialized reproductive structures. The plant thrives in fast-flowing freshwater environments, often growing on submerged rocks or logs. Its morphology is adapted to aquatic conditions, with a reduced root system and a highly branched stem. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from environmental degradation.
